description: This table contains general history information for each type of medication warning or advisory. Since each warning could be triggered in different activities at different times, it contains general warning information for each time the warning was triggered. To get patient information, link this table to the ALERT table and then link the ALERT table to the PATIENT or PAT_ENC table. To get order related information for each medication warning or advisory, link this table to ALT_ORDINFO. To get specific medication or condition information for each medication warning type, link this table to specific medication warning related tables, such as the ALT_DRUG_ALLERGY table for drug-allergy warnings; the ALT_DRUG_DFALC table for drug-drug, drug-food, and drug-alcohol warnings; the ALT_DRUG_DUPTHERPY and ALT_DRUG_DUPTHYMED tables for duplicate therapy warnings; the ALT_DRUG_IV and ALT_DRUG_IVMED tables for IV warnings; and the ALT_DRUG_PREGNANCY and ALT_DRUG_PREGMED tables for pregnancy warnings.

columns.name: ALT_ID
columns.description: The unique warning ID for each warning. You could link it to ALERT.ALT_ID to get patient and vendor information in table ALERT.

columns.name: ALT_DATE_REAL
columns.description: This is a numeric representation of the date of the contact. The integer portion of the number specifies the date of the encounter. The digits after the decimal point indicate multiple times on one day.

columns.name: ALT_CSN_ID
columns.description: A unique serial number for this contact. This number is unique across all warnings in the system.

columns.name: CONTACT_DATE
columns.description: The date of this contact in calendar format.

columns.name: ALT_STATUS_C_NAME
columns.description:
The status category number for the warning after it was viewed in Hyperspace. This describes any actions the user took on the warning. Link it to ZC_ALT_STATUS.ALT_STATUS_C to get the name, title, and abbreviation information for the warning status.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Overridden


Removed


Filtered


Canceled


Deferred


Viewed


Held

columns.name: USER_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the user who triggered the warning. This column is frequently used to link to the CLARITY_EMP table.

columns.name: SHOWN_PLACE_C_NAME
columns.description:
The place where you see the warning. You could link it to ZC_SHOWN_PLACE.SHOWN_PLACE_C to get name, title, and abbreviation for shown place.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries:

columns.name: OVERALL_OVR_RSN_C_NAME
columns.description:
For medication interactions, when you override & accept them, if an overall override reason is given at the bottom of the warning pop-up form, it will be saved here. You could link it to ZC_ALRT_SP_OVR_RSN.ALRT_SP_OVR_RSN_C to get name, title, and abbreviation for the reason.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes

columns.name: OVERALL_OVR_CMNT
columns.description: For medication interactions, when you override & accept the warning pop-up form, if an overall override comment is given at the bottom of the form, it will be saved here. We only extract the first 255 characters.

columns.name: SPEC_OVR_RSN_C_NAME
columns.description:
The specific override reason given for an overridden medication interaction. Link to ZC_ALRT_SP_OVR_RSN.ALRT_SP_OVR_RSN_C to get the name, title, and abbreviation for the override reason. 


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: OVERALL_OVR_RSN_C_NAME

columns.name: SPEC_OVR_CMNT
columns.description: For medication interactions, when you override & accept the warning pop-up form, if a specific override comment is given on the right of the form, it will be saved here. We only extract the first 1000 characters.

columns.name: IMMUNIZATION_LPL_ID
columns.description: The patientï¿½s immunization problem list ID for a specific immunization-allergy interaction.

columns.name: IMPORTANCE_LVL_C_NAME
columns.description:
Stores the importance level of a warning, a value that is used to determine which warnings are displayed at the top of the interactions popup. Can be used to compare the importance of different warning types.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


Very High


High


Medium


Low


Very Low

columns.name: PROVIDER_TYPE_C_NAME
columns.description:
Stores a provider type for the user who triggered the warning.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


Resource


Physician

columns.name: SPECIFIC_DEFR_RSN_C_NAME
columns.description:
For medication interactions, when you override & accept the warnings pop-up, if the warning is deferred and if a specific deferral reason is given in the defer window of the warning, it will be saved here. You could link it to ZC_SPECIFIC_DEFR_R.SPECIFIC_DEFR_R_C to get the name, title, and abbreviation for the deferral reason.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 No Entries Defined

columns.name: DOSING_WEIGHT
columns.description: Weight used for dose checking. Always stored in kilograms.

columns.name: WT_RECORD_DATETIME
columns.description: The instant at which the weight was recorded.

columns.name: WT_SOURCE_C_NAME
columns.description:
The weight source.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


Treatment plan weight


Past measured weight


Most current measured weight (actual)


Ideal body weight


Adjusted body weight


User entered weight


Lean body weight


Dosing weight


Other

columns.name: WT_COMMENTS
columns.description: Generated comment for weight.

columns.name: DOSING_HEIGHT
columns.description: Height used for dosing warning. Always stored in inches.

columns.name: HT_RECORD_DATETIME
columns.description: The instant at which the height was recorded.

columns.name: HT_SOURCE_C_NAME
columns.description:
The height source.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


Treatment plan height


Past measured height


Most current measured height (Actual)


User Entry


Other

columns.name: DOSING_BSA
columns.description: The body surface area used for dosing checking. Always stored in m2.

columns.name: BSA_SOURCE_C_NAME
columns.description:
The body surface area source.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


Treatment plan BSA


Based on weight and height measured in the past


Based on most recent measured weight and height (actual)


User Entry


Based on ideal body weight and current/past measured height


Based on adjusted body weight and current/past measured height


Based on dosing weight and current/past measured height


Based on normalized BSA 1.7m2


Other

columns.name: BSA_CALC_DETAIL
columns.description: The body surface area calculation details with weight, height and recorded instants.

columns.name: ALERT_ALLERGEN_ID
columns.description: The allergen ID of drug-allergy warning.

columns.name: ALERT_ALLERGEN_ID_ALLERGEN_NAME
columns.description: The name of the allergen record.

columns.name: INACT_INGRED_IND_YN
columns.description:
It indicates whether the warning is fired because of inactive ingredient.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


No


Yes

columns.name: ALERT_ROOT_ALLER_ID
columns.description: This column stores the allergen ID of the allergen that caused the warning to fire.

columns.name: ALERT_ROOT_ALLER_ID_ALLERGEN_NAME
columns.description: The name of the allergen record.

columns.name: ALERT_MED_CLASS_ID
columns.description: Contains the allergen class of the medication for a cross-sensitive warning.

columns.name: ALERT_MED_CLASS_ID_ALLERGEN_NAME
columns.description: The name of the allergen record.

columns.name: PATIENT_DEP_ID
columns.description: This column stores the patient's department at the time when the warning was fired.

columns.name: ALERT_ALLERGY_ID
columns.description: The problem list record that contains the allergen for a drug-allergy warning.

columns.name: CONTACT_NUM
columns.description: The number of the ALT contacts for the given ALT record.

columns.name: IS_NONFILTERED_YN
columns.description:
Indicate whether the warning is non-filtered.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Yes


No
